message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.NE 

This paper deals with practical applications of Reinforcement Learning (RL) and proposes a neural architecture for estimating risk and optimizing policies under general risk measures. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it deals with the development of algorithms and models for learning from data. The paper also involves the use of Monte-Carlo simulations, which is a common technique in Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Robotics (cs.RO). The paper also deals with control systems (cs.SY) as it involves optimizing policies under risk measures. Finally, the paper proposes a neural architecture for estimating risk, which falls under the sub-category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE).
